Imports

sqlite_wrapper

Types

DbConn = sqlite.PSqlite3
Encapsulates a database connection. Note that this is just an alias for sqlite_wrapper.PSqlite3. 
DbMode = enum
  dbRead, dbReadWrite
SqliteError = object of CatchableError
  errorCode*: int32 ## \
                  ## This is the error code that was returned by the underlying
                  ## SQLite library. Constants for the different possible
                  ## values of this field exists in the
                  ## ``tiny_sqlite/sqlite_wrapper`` module.
Raised when an error in the underlying SQLite library occurs. 
DbValueKind = enum
  sqliteNull, sqliteInteger, sqliteReal, sqliteText, sqliteBlob
Enum of all possible value types in a Sqlite database. 
DbValue = object
  case kind*: DbValueKind
  of sqliteInteger:
      intVal*: int64

  of sqliteReal:
      floatVal*: float64

  of sqliteText:
      strVal*: string

  of sqliteBlob:
      blobVal*: seq[byte]

  of sqliteNull:
      nil
Represents a value in a SQLite database.

Call fromDbValue on each element of row and return it as a tuple. 
proc `$`(dbVal: DbValue): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
proc exec(db: DbConn; sql: string; params: varargs[DbValue, toDbValue]) {...}{.
    raises: [SqliteError], tags: [].}
Executes sql and raises SqliteError if not successful. 
proc execMany(db: DbConn; sql: string; params: seq[seq[DbValue]]) {...}{.
    raises: [SqliteError], tags: [].}
Executes sql repeatedly using each element of params as parameters. 
proc execScript(db: DbConn; sql: string) {...}{.raises: [SqliteError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Executes the query and raises SqliteError if not successful. 
proc rows(db: DbConn; sql: string; params: varargs[DbValue, toDbValue]): seq[
    seq[DbValue]] {...}{.raises: [SqliteError, AssertionError], tags: [].}
Executes the query and returns the resulting rows. 
proc openDatabase(path: string; mode = dbReadWrite): DbConn {...}{.raises: [SqliteError],
    tags: [].}

Open a new database connection to a database file. To create a in-memory database the special path ":memory:" can be used. If the database doesn't already exist and mode is dbReadWrite, the database will be created. If the database doesn't exist and mode is dbRead, a SqliteError exception will be raised.

NOTE: To avoid memory leaks, db.close must be called when the database connection is no longer needed.

Examples:

let memDb = openDatabase(":memory:")
proc close(db: DbConn) {...}{.raises: [SqliteError], tags: [].}
Closes the database connection. 
proc lastInsertRowId(db: DbConn): int64 {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Get the row id of the last inserted row. For tables with an integer primary key, the row id will be the primary key.

For more information, refer to the SQLite documentation (https://www.sqlite.org/c3ref/last_insert_rowid.html).

proc changes(db: DbConn): int32 {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Get the number of changes triggered by the most recent INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE statement.

For more information, refer to the SQLite documentation (https://www.sqlite.org/c3ref/changes.html).

proc isReadonly(db: DbConn): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns true if db is in readonly mode.

    raises: [SqliteError, AssertionError], tags: [].}
Executes the query and iterates over the result dataset.
